intro: Hepetis pulchella, commonly known as the pretty bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its blue or purple flowers bloom in late spring. Hepetis pulchella is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
